name: Transformation
description: A narrative pattern focused on personal or societal change and growth.

examples.title: A Christmas Carol
examples.description: Scrooge's transformation from a miser to a generous person through supernatural intervention.

examples.title: Groundhog Day
examples.description: Phil's transformation from a cynical weatherman to a better person through repeated living of the same day.

examples.title: Jane Eyre
examples.description: Jane's transformation through adversity to find her own autonomy and ultimate happiness.

key_characteristics: Focus on internal change rather than external challenges
Often involves identity crisis and resolution
Character begins in a flawed or limited state
Character must lose something to gain something greater
Ends with a new equilibrium that incorporates the transformation

Status Quo.description: The initial stable condition before transformation
examples: Phil Connors as selfish and cynical

Disruption.description: An event that challenges the status quo
Disruption.function: Force character out of comfort zone

Resistance.description: Character fights against the needed change
Resistance.function: Demonstrate the strength of character flaws
examples: Scrooge dismisses the first ghost's lessons
Phil exploits the time loop for selfish gains

Struggle.description: Character experiences difficulty in process of change
examples: Phil experiences depression and suicide attempts
Phil discovers meaning through helping others

Integration.description: Character begins to embody new values or identity
examples: Scrooge begins to treat others differently
Phil becomes skilled at piano, ice sculpture, etc.

New Normal.function: Demonstrate transformation is complete and sustainable
examples: Phil escapes time loop as a better person
